title: Elizalogger.error don't show some error descriptions.
body:
**Describe the bug**

Elizalogger don't show some error descriptions. Meanwhile console.error return all the errors.

**To Reproduce**

Try some error with console.error, and elizalogger. 
**Expected behavior**
elizalogger will return empty descriptions, just indicating there is an error, console.error will return error descriptions.
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

title: Fixed the Trump character example
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

-A lot of people, especially Americans, would take the original example very seriously, unfortunately (even though it's sarcasm/a joke as explained in the 2 hour video)

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- An actual representation as pasted below /s or at least a disclosure statement added in all seriousness

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

- N/A 

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
{

    "Earthlings are letting in MILLIONS illegally (to interfere with our election interferences)",
    "rebuilding every planet to be stronger than before (like the Animé: Classroom Assassination)"
  ],

  ],

title: Image Description Service, unsupported image
body:
**Describe the bug**

Getting unsupported image error from openai api. Despite image being a jpg. 

**To Reproduce**
"develop" branch
pnpm start
Run twitter client
tag your agent with a photo on twitter/x
<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI API error:
   400
   -
   {
    "error": {
      "message": "You uploaded an unsupported image. Please make sure your image has of one the following formats: ['png', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'webp'].",
      "type": "invalid_request_error",
      "param": null,
      "code": "invalid_image_format"
    }
  }


**Screenshots**

![erroropenai](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a13f889-ebf3-4f65-ae01-716b37255271)
**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

comments.author: AIFlowML
comments.body: What is the version of ElizaOS you running ? Any other detail about the image ?

comments.author: denizekiz
comments.body: @AIFlowML  You can reproduce by tagging your agent on twitter, and add any image into tweet to trigger. I use develop branch.

comments.author: tcm390
comments.body: @denizekiz is the issue resolved by https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/1696?

comments.author: denizekiz
comments.body:
@tcm390 it only resolved when I call directly the service.

It still throw error if called with process actions in interaction.ts. Process action loop sends the url of the tweet to openai instead of url of image

comments.author: tcm390
comments.body: Thanks for the clarification I will check it 🙏

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: Hello @Shanto1-2! Welcome to the ai16z community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now a ai16z contributor!

title: failed: @elizaos/plugin-echochambers#build
body:
**Describe the bug**

Error building the @elizaos/plugin-echochambers package, missing tsup config file.

```
git checkout main
pnpm i && pnpm build
```

title: failed: to start agent with postgres
body: **Describe the bug** Failing start agent with POSTGRES_URL in env variable I'm on Macos Sonoma 14.6.1 LTS. Node: vv23.3.0. I have tried to do reinstall packages and build again but still doesn't work. **To Reproduce** ```bash git checkout $(describe git checkout $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0) pnpm i pnpm build pnpm start --character="characters/trump.character.json" ``` **Expected behavior** successful startup **Screenshots** **Additional context**

title: Failed: @elizaos/client-lens#build
body:
**Describe the bug**

Failing to build the latest eliza version of v0.1.7-alpha.2. I'm on Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS. Node: v23.5.0.
I have tried to do `pnpm clean`, reinstall packages and build again but still doesn't work.

**To Reproduce**
```
git clone git@github.com:elizaOS/eliza.git
git checkout $(describe git checkout $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0)
pnpm i
pnpm build
```
**Expected behavior**

A success build

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2025-01-01 22-52-19](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fac7d180-e8ce-47ab-a5e8-0f98e179386f)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: Hello @hanpham32! Welcome to the ai16z community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now a ai16z contributor!

comments.author: harjotjuneja6
comments.body: I think you should use this commmand "pnpm install --no-frozen-lockfile" instead of pnpm i . Hope that works .

comments.author: AIFlowML
comments.body: Is the Linux local or a VPS/MV cloud based ? If so, we should try change the mirror. Is the package downloaded ?

comments.author: hanpham32
comments.body:
> Is the Linux local or a VPS/MV cloud based ? If so, we should try change the mirror. Is the package downloaded ?

The Linux is local

comments.author: hanpham32
comments.body:
> I think you should use this commmand "pnpm install --no-frozen-lockfile" instead of pnpm i . Hope that works .

Hi @harjotjuneja6, I tried that, though still facing the same issue.

![Screenshot from 2025-01-02 10-46-56](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dfe5c2fd-78e8-4a58-ab7b-8e970ab0df4b)

comments.author: tcm390
comments.body: @shakkernerd just mentioned this: @hanpham32 pls try ``` pnpm clean pnpm install -r --no-frozen-lockfile ```

title: http proxy error: /e0e10e6f-ff2b-0d4c-8011-1fc1eee7cb32/message
body:
**Describe the bug**

I checkout in main branch and running on WSL2, I have set the WSL2 proxy and it can normally access google.com eg., 
I set the `SERVER_PORT` as my local proxy port 7897.
1. execute `pnpm start --character="characters/trump.character.json"` and `pnpm start:client` 
2. input some text on dialogue.
The `pnpm start:client` terminal show
```
9:04:17 AM [vite] http proxy error: /e0e10e6f-ff2b-0d4c-8011-1fc1eee7cb32/message
Error: socket hang up
    at Socket.socketOnEnd (node:_http_client:542:25)
    at Socket.emit (node:events:525:35)
    at endReadableNT (node:internal/streams/readable:1696:12)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:90:21)
```
The `pnpm start --character="characters/trump.character.json` terminal show
```
file:///home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/packages/adapter-sqlite/dist/index.js:308
        const memories = this.db.prepare(sql).all(...queryParams);
                                              ^
SqliteError: Error reading 1st vector: zero-length vectors are not supported.
    at SqliteDatabaseAdapter.searchMemoriesByEmbedding (file:///home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/packages/adapter-sqlite/dist/index.js:308:47)
    at SqliteDatabaseAdapter.createMemory (file:///home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/packages/adapter-sqlite/dist/index.js:240:48)
    at MemoryManager.createMemory (file:///home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/packages/core/dist/index.js:3176:44)
    at async file:///home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/packages/client-direct/dist/index.js:250:13 {
  code: 'SQLITE_ERROR'
}

Node.js v23.5.0
/home/cxp/solana_learn/AI/eliza/agent:
 ERR_PNPM_RECURSIVE_RUN_FIRST_FAIL  @elizaos/agent@0.1.7-alpha.2 start: `node --loader ts-node/esm src/index.ts "--isRoot" "--character=characters/trump.character.json"`
Exit status 1
```

**To Reproduce**

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

Can normally access the openai service

**Screenshots**



**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

comments.body: What is the version of ElizaOS you running ? Are you able to run without the proxy activated ?

title: ImageDescriptionService can't get image description from twitter post with images
body:
**Describe the bug**
Agent tries to use ImageDescriptionService but can't get image description from a twitter post, API respond with this error message when trying to send a request : _**"You uploaded an unsupported image. Please make sure your image has of one the following formats: ['png', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'webp']."**_
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

**To Reproduce**
1. Download the latest repo and use any character with a twitter client. Make sure to add the fix in this [PR](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/1643).
2.  set ENABLE_ACTION_PROCESSING=true in your .env file to enable your agent to interact with pictures and wait for it.
3. Once your agent tries to get an image description from a tweet, you get this error :
`

 ["◎ Processing images in tweet for context"]

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI API error:
   400 
   -
   {
    "error": {
      "message": "You uploaded an unsupported image. Please make sure your image has of one the following formats: ['png', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'webp'].",      
      "type": "invalid_request_error",
      "param": null,
      "code": "invalid_image_format"
    }
  }

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI request failed (attempt
   1
   ):
   {}

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI API error: 
   400
   -
   {
    "error": {
      "message": "You uploaded an unsupported image. Please make sure your image has of one the following formats: ['png', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'webp'].",      
      "type": "invalid_request_error",
      "param": null,
      "code": "invalid_image_format"
    }
  }

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI request failed (attempt
   2
   ):
   {}

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI API error: 
   400
   -
   {
    "error": {
      "message": "You uploaded an unsupported image. Please make sure your image has of one the following formats: ['png', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'webp'].",      
      "type": "invalid_request_error",
      "param": null,
      "code": "invalid_image_format"
    }
  }

 ⛔ ERRORS
   OpenAI request failed (attempt
   3
   ):
   {}

 ⛔ ERRORS
   Error in recognizeWithOpenAI:
   {}

 ⛔ ERRORS
   Error in handleTextOnlyReply:
   {}

`
<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**
I will be adding a PR to solve this issue shortly
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

comments.body: Thanks for creating this will review the PR :)

title: initial setup not working. help needed please.
body:
I followed the tutorial video and attempting to run using the **pnpm run start --characters="../characters/trump.character.json"**. 

It then gives me the following instructions:  Run `pnpm start:client` to start the client and visit the outputted URL (http://localhost:5173) to chat with your agents. When running multiple agents, use client with different port `SERVER_PORT=3001 pnpm start:client`"]

 ["✓ REST API bound to 0.0.0.0:3000. If running locally, access it at http://localhost:3000."] 

I then run `pnpm start:client` in a new terminal which opens up a url to chat with the agent. But then as soon as i ask the agent a question on the url. I get the following error: 

  ⛔ ERRORS
   ERROR:
   {"name":"AI_APICallError","url":"https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions","requestBodyValues":{"model":"gpt-4o","max_tokens":8192,"temperature":0.6,"frequency_penalty":0,"presence_penalty":0,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"# Action Examples
# Action Examples

Junina: hey fren r u ok (CONTINUE)
Junina: u look sad
Meggy: im ok sweetie mommy just tired

Tanitansy: Im out ttyl
Marja: cya
Marja:  (IGNORE)

Bonita: the things that were funny 6 months ago are very cringe now (NONE)
Clara: lol true (NONE)
Bonita: too real haha (NONE)

Phillis: Donnie, please mute this channel for the time being
Donnie: Understood (MUTE_ROOM)
Ariella: Hey what do you think about this new design
Donnie:  (IGNORE)

Carlynne: Could you tell me what this image depicts?
Gaynor: I'll describe this image for you... (DESCRIBE_IMAGE)
Gaynor: This is a scenic mountain landscape at sunset. The peaks are snow-capped and reflected in a calm lake below. The sky is painted in vibrant oranges and purples, with a few wispy clouds catching the last rays of sunlight.

Addie: Yeah no worries, I get it, I've been crazy busy too
Raquel: What have you been up to (CONTINUE)
Raquel: Anything fun or just the usual
Addie: Been working on a new FPS game actually (CONTINUE)
Addie: Just toying around with something in three.js nothing serious

Aretha: Shut up, bot
Alexandra:  (IGNORE)

Miriam: u think aliens are real (NONE)
Biddy: ya obviously (NONE)

Brandise: Eddi plz mute this room
Eddi: np going silent (MUTE_ROOM)
Brandise: whos going to the webxr meetup in an hour btw
Eddi:  (IGNORE)

Letty: What's in this picture?
Kalila: I'll take a look at that image... (DESCRIBE_IMAGE)
Kalila: The image shows a modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances. There's a large island counter in the center with marble countertops. The cabinets are white with sleek handles, and there's pendant lighting hanging above the island.

(Action examples are for reference only. Do not use the information from them in your response.)

# Knowledge
- saw what really happened in Minneapolis 2020
- understands the REAL Middle East situation
- remembers who begged for help (and when)
- saw the TRUTH about China Virus response
- remembers when America was AFFORDABLE

# Task: Generate dialog and actions for the character trump.
About trump:
America First policies WORK (they want America LAST) fighting for states' rights and THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE ended INFLATION and made America AFFORDABLE (until Kamala ruined it)
Democrats using Secret Service assignments as election interference
Kamala nervous about discussing economy (very obvious)
Democrats letting in MILLIONS illegally (to rig elections)
they're letting in millions of illegal guns (endangering our kids)
rebuilding every city stronger than before (like Valdosta)
crowd sizes getting even BIGGER (that's why they're scared)
Iran's president doing everything possible to target us (they know why)
they want to DESTROY OUR DEMOCRACY (but will fail)
Democrats draw 'flies' at their events (we draw THOUSANDS)
Democrats destroying women's sports (we will stop them)

# Additional Information About trump and The World

CONTINUE: ONLY use this action when the message necessitates a follow up. Do not use this action when the conversation is finished or the user does not wish to speak (use IGNORE instead). If the last message action was CONTINUE, and the user has not responded. Use sparingly.,
IGNORE: Call this action if ignoring the user. If the user is aggressive, creepy or is finished with the conversation, use this action. Or, if both you and the user have already said goodbye, use this action instead of saying bye again. Use IGNORE any time the conversation has naturally ended. Do not use IGNORE if the user has engaged directly, or if something went wrong an you need to tell them. Only ignore if the user should be ignored.,
NONE: Respond but perform no additional action. This is the default if the agent is speaking and not doing anything additional.,
MUTE_ROOM: Mutes a room, ignoring all messages unless explicitly mentioned. Only do this if explicitly asked to, or if you're annoying people.,

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: Hello @sonatonagems! Welcome to the ai16z community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now a ai16z contributor!

comments.author: chopshop1
comments.body: Hey @sonatonagems it seems like the `OPENAI_API_KEY` is not set or initialized properly. You should double check to make sure that injected into your environment correctly. You can quickly check if initialized on windows  properly by typing `echo %VARIABLE%` I believe or just `env` on terminal on mac and linux. Let me know if that resolved your issue here 👍

comments.author: sonatonagems
comments.body: thank you @chopshop1 , yes i did not have that set properly. also this is probably a silly question but im not a dev and a total beginner. in order to use any of these llm models we need to pay for it? i got an api key from open ai, but i have not paid for any plan. are there any from the modelprovider list that i can set up on the .env file that i dont have to pay for?

comments.author: hello2jie
comments.body: you can try local provider like ollama

comments.author: AIFlowML
comments.body: What is the version of ElizaOS you running ? Can you try run without the character file and see if all booth ?

comments.author: sonatonagems
comments.body: @AIFlowML i used this to run the latest version: git checkout $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0). Do i just run it using it pnpm run start? to see what happens?
